description.narrative: The intended project impact is that (1) improved climate change mitigation through reduced deforestation and greenhouse gas emission levels, (2) enhanced environmental sustainability through sustainable wood harvesting plans and forest-friendly agricultural practices and (3) leveraged returns on biomass resources through carbon credit sales, more efficient production technologies as well as biomass energy-friendly revenue policies, contribute to the sustainable development of Tanzania and its people. The project foresees two interlinked components, the first on establishing a pro-poor value-chain for sustainable charcoal, the second on conducting thorough research and advocacy work facilitating the introduction of more biomass energy-friendly policies. There is a high potential for climate change mitigation as more efficient and sustainable charcoal making reduces CO2 emissions. It also contributes to poverty reduction as sustainable charcoal producers benefit from higher product revenues and more reliable sales. The real extent of the climate change mitigation and poverty reduction impact is measured by scientific methods during project implementation. Outcome 1 is the establishment of commercially viable value chains for legal, sustainably sourced charcoal; Outcome 2 aims at the communication of credible biomass energy-related data and analysis through coordinated advocacy leading to more biomass-friendly governance and policies in Tanzania’s energy sector.
